title: Hertford Union Canal Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Hertford Union Canal by Derek Harper, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Hertford Union Canal

images.title: Dr Neil Clifton / Hertford Union Canal: approaching the top lock
images.caption: Approaching the top lock. Looking west. The canal joins the Lee Navigation with the Regent's Canal, and is very useful for boaters making for the Lee from the main system. There are just three locks, quite close together.

images.title: Middle lock, Hertford Union Canal by Robin Webster, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Middle lock.

images.title: Timothy Baldwin / Hertford Union Canal
images.caption: This is a cycle path, however it seems only an unlaiden bicycle of standard design can fit though the barrier. It seems non-standard bicycles and luggage is forbidden.

images.title: Regent's Canal: jct. with Hertford Union Canal by Gareth James, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Regent's Canal, jct. with Hertford Union Canal

images.title: Kenneth Yarham / The Hertford Union Canal from Three Colt Bridge
images.caption: From Three Colt Bridge. The photograph is looking towards the Lee Navigation. Victoria Park is on the left, alongside the canal, and the new housing on the other side of the canal replaced old industrial premises and warehouses.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The junction of Lee Navigation and Hertford Union Canal. The 2012 Olympic Park construction can be seen by the canal in this photo from 2009.

images.title: John Davies / Hertford Union Canal, Bow
images.caption: Bow

description: Enjoy an easy, waterside walk or cycle along this canal in Tower Hamlets. It runs for about a mile, linking the Regent's Canal and the Lea Valley Walk. You'll pass a series of locks and bridges along the way. It runs alongside Victoria Park so there is scope for continuing your walk through the park or along the Regent's Canal. The canal also visits the, Olympic Park where you can pick up the Lea Navigation and the Limehouse Cut Canal.
display_address: Coqfighter, 96, White Post Lane, Fish Island, Bow, London Borough of Tower Hamlets, London, Greater London, England, E9 5EN, United Kingdom
